info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bradford and northwestern Wyoming Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of New Albany, or 11 miles southwest of Wyalusing, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tunkhannock, Wilmot, Hollenback, Mehoopany, Wyalusing, Meshoppen, Forkston, Laceyville, Kasson Brook and Osterhout. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
